intro: Lettsomia rubicunda, commonly known as the scarlet bellflower, is a striking member of the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red petals and tubular corolla, which are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Lettsomia rubicunda is often cultivated in gardens for its unique color and floral structure.
